column4: I have downloaded virtualbox_1.5.2-25.deb file. Have any of you succeded using it with an XP ?
yes, many have
so I install it and make a VM for WinXP so I can use Win progs in it? Really?
yep, you run windows in a window
this sounds fantastic but, what about this files? libxerces27 libxalan110. Are they secure ?
hmm, what are those files?
Ubuntu package installers advices me that they could have malicious code. Are they safe, how can I check?
pastebin the exact errors
it is in my language, not english you wouldn't understand. What can I do?
I'm installing anyway
I understad spanish well enough
my system is *not*  in spanish, it's basque
ah, my mustake, just went by ip.  You can run 'LANGUAGE=en apt-cache policy PACKAGE' for the offending packages
No problem, I just wanted to know about those warning files, anyway let me fibish installation...
And I'm reading the license in case...
So it says that it can only be used for a few weeks, what happens afterwards?
erm... what package did you grab exactly?  http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads should not say that
VirtualBox 1.5.2 for Linux Hosts: * Ubuntu 7.10 ("Gutsy Gibbon") i386 | AMD64
I should have downloaded the OSE ?
nope, I use the other one as well.  Where exactly are you reading this limit?
I read the limit in the license, wich says that it's for educational purposes etc...
oh, I see.  I guess you are technically correct, but it is up to you to decide how long you want to evaluate it
would there be any difference if I add the repository and install it by apt-get? How did you do that?
difference would be update-manager will notify you of updates about virtualbox.  Join me in #ubuntu-classroom if you want to do that and the instructions there are not clear
